bones are 
growing and developing very 
rapidly in these early years.  
 
Babies fed infant formula 
will only need a vitamin 
D supplement if they are 
receiving less than 500ml 
(about a pint) of infant 
formula a day, because 
infant formula has vitamin 
D added during processing.  
Children aged 1 to 4 years 
require a daily supplement 
of 10 micrograms of vitamin 
D throughout the year. 
 
Everyone	aged	five	and	
over should consider 
taking a supplement of 10 
micrograms of vitamin D
